subject: Management
title: Performative Culture
description: A quick, practical guide to Performative Culture.

hook.text: Employees worked late to look busy. Their actual output was done by 4pm every day.

buildup.text: Performative cultures reward the appearance of work over actual results. Optics beat outcomes.

discovery.text: Face-time culture: being seen matters more than what you produce. It punishes efficient workers.

twist.text: The best performers often look least busy because they work efficiently. Performative culture penalizes them.

climax.text: Measure outputs, not hours. Celebrate results, not effort theater. Let people leave when done.

punchline.text: If you reward looking busy, you'll get a culture of actors.

quiz.question: What is the core problem with performative cultures?
options: They reward the appearance of work over actual measurable results
They focus too much on results and not enough on effort
Performance cultures only exist in large corporations
